text:
An association of ex-paramilitary officials has decided to hold a protest march to Parliament and launch an indefinite ‘dharna’ at Jantar Mantar on March 15 to press for One Rank One Pension (OROP) and other service benefits as granted by the government to ex-servicemen recently.

“The association issued a one-month notice to the government on February 10 in this regard,” Secretary General of Confederation of Ex-Paramilitary Forces Welfare Association, P.S. Nair, said in a statement.

The association had staged protests last year demanding OROP and other service benefits for the personnel of these forces which include the Central Reserve Police Force, Border Security Force, Central Industrial Security Force, Indo-Tibetan Border Police and Sashastra Seema Bal. — PTI
title: Ex-paramilitary officials to launch dharna for OROP
